IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER STUDENT PROGRAMS TO CHILDREN.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of Ridgefield Academy is to educate and encourage students to become knowledgeable, independent thinkers who are passionate about learning and embrace new challenges with confidence and enthusiasm. The School strives to equip children with the skills, knowledge, and values necessary for success in school and in life.
IRS990.Description: INSTRUCTION OF APPROXIMATELY 723 PRE-SCHOOL AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN BY APPROXIMATELY 107 QUALIFIED INSTRUCTORS

Activity3.Description: CONDUCTING AN AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Furtherance of the organization's exempt purpose and donor stipulations.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: NOTED IN GENERAL PUBLICATIONS AND ADVERTISEMENTS

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: reduction of tuition cost charged to student

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: the organization maintains a listing of all scholarship recipients and amounts awarded to each student.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: On-campus housing is provided to the Head of School.
Part I, Line 4b: Jim Heus $30,000 THE ABOVE AMOUNT IS INCLUDED IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN C.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: TO PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY 42 acre RIDGEFIELD campus

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: 11 IS THE NUMBER OF ACTUAL CONTRIBUTIONS MADE.
BROKERS USED TO SELL GIFTS OF SECURITIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY OTHER COMMITTEES WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN ACCORDANCE WITH A BOARD RESOLUTION, THE TREASURER REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE RETURN. IN ADDITION, THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: On an annual basis, all board members and top management officials are required to fill out a conflict of interest policy. all potential issues are reviewed and resolved immediately.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the board of trustees performs an evaluation of the head of school each year. the compensation committee reviews the results of the evaluation and makes recommendations for compensation, which are voted upon by the board at the june meeting.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the organization's governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are photocopied and mailed to individuals or organizations upon request.
